segments.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho anāthapiṇḍikaṃ gahapatiṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: Seated to one side, the Buddha said to the householder Anāthapiṇḍika:

segments.pli: “citte, gahapati, byāpanne kāyakammampi byāpannaṃ hoti, vacīkammampi byāpannaṃ hoti, manokammampi byāpannaṃ hoti.
segments.en: “Householder, when the mind is fallen, bodily, verbal, and mental deeds are fallen.

segments.pli: Tassa byāpannakāyakammantassa byāpannavacīkammantassa byāpannamanokammantassa na bhaddakaṃ maraṇaṃ hoti, na bhaddikā kālakiriyā.
segments.en: Someone whose deeds of body, speech, and mind are fallen will not have a good death.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, gahapati, kūṭāgāre ducchanne kūṭampi byāpannaṃ hoti, gopānasiyopi byāpannā honti, bhittipi byāpannā hoti;
segments.en: It’s like a bungalow with a bad roof. The roof peak, rafters, and walls fall in.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho, gahapati, citte byāpanne kāyakammampi byāpannaṃ hoti, vacīkammampi byāpannaṃ hoti, manokammampi byāpannaṃ hoti.
segments.en: In the same way, when the mind is fallen, bodily, verbal, and mental deeds are fallen.

segments.pli: Tassa byāpannakāyakammantassa byāpannavacīkammantassa byāpannamanokammantassa na bhaddakaṃ maraṇaṃ hoti, na bhaddikā kālakiriyā.
segments.en: Someone whose deeds of body, speech, and mind are fallen will not have a good death.

segments.pli: Citte, gahapati, abyāpanne kāyakammampi abyāpannaṃ hoti, vacīkammampi abyāpannaṃ hoti, manokammampi abyāpannaṃ hoti.
segments.en: When the mind is not fallen, bodily, verbal, and mental deeds are not fallen.

segments.pli: Tassa abyāpannakāyakammantassa abyāpannavacīkammantassa abyāpannamanokammantassa bhaddakaṃ maraṇaṃ hoti, bhaddikā kālakiriyā.
segments.en: Someone whose deeds of body, speech, and mind are not fallen will have a good death.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, gahapati, kūṭāgāre succhanne kūṭampi abyāpannaṃ hoti, gopānasiyopi abyāpannā honti, bhittipi abyāpannā hoti;
segments.en: It’s like a bungalow with a good roof. The roof peak, rafters, and walls are not fallen in.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho, gahapati, citte abyāpanne kāyakammampi abyāpannaṃ hoti, vacīkammampi abyāpannaṃ hoti, manokammampi abyāpannaṃ hoti.
segments.en: In the same way, when the mind is not fallen, bodily, verbal, and mental deeds are not fallen.

segments.pli: Tassa abyāpannakāyakammantassa … pe … abyāpannamanokammantassa bhaddakaṃ maraṇaṃ hoti, bhaddikā kālakiriyā”ti.
segments.en: Someone whose deeds of body, speech, and mind are not fallen will have a good death.”
